headline: Shannon's Information Theory
teaser: A brief overview of Claude Shannon's groundbreaking work.

body.text: Claude Shannon introduced information theory in 1948, laying the foundation for digital communication.
Shannon's work enabled the development of efficient coding and data transmission methods.

headline: Entropy in Communication
teaser: Understanding the role of entropy in measuring information.

body.text: Entropy quantifies the unpredictability in a message, helping optimize encoding schemes.
Information theory is essential for modern data science and telecommunications.
